title: Jollof Rice
summary: A classic West African one-pot rice dish cooked with tomatoes, peppers, and spices.
instructions: Parboil rice and set aside.
Blend tomatoes, peppers, and onion.
Fry the mixture in oil with spices until thick.
Add rice, stock, and seasoning, then cook until soft.
Serve with fried plantain or chicken.

title: Egusi Soup
summary: A hearty Nigerian soup made with ground melon seeds, leafy greens, and assorted meats.
instructions: Grind egusi and set aside.
Heat palm oil, add onions and fry.
Add meat stock and egusi paste.
Stir and cook until thick.
Add vegetables and simmer before serving.

title: Suya
summary: Popular street food of spicy grilled beef skewers coated with yaji (suya spice mix).
instructions: Marinate beef with suya spice and oil.
Thread beef onto skewers.
Grill over open flame until cooked.
Serve with sliced onions and tomatoes.

title: Moi Moi
summary: Steamed bean pudding made from blended black-eyed peas, peppers, and spices.
instructions: Blend beans, peppers, and onion into a smooth paste.
Add oil and seasoning, mix well.
Pour into containers or leaves.
Steam until firm and cooked through.

title: Pounded Yam and Efo Riro
summary: Smooth pounded yam served with a rich spinach and tomato-based stew.
instructions: Boil yam until soft, then pound until smooth.
Prepare stew with tomatoes, palm oil, and spices.
Add spinach and meats to the stew.
Serve hot with pounded yam.

title: Akara
summary: Deep-fried bean cakes made from blended black-eyed peas and onions, often eaten at breakfast.
instructions: Blend beans, onion, and pepper into a thick paste.
Whisk mixture to incorporate air.
Scoop batter into hot oil and fry until golden brown.
Serve hot with pap or bread.

title: Pepper Soup
summary: A spicy and aromatic broth made with fish, goat meat, or chicken and traditional spices.
instructions: Boil meat or fish with seasoning.
Add pepper soup spices and chili.
Simmer until tender.
Add scent leaves before serving.

title: Ofada Rice and Ayamase
summary: Local Nigerian rice served with green pepper stew, usually spicy and flavorful.
instructions: Cook Ofada rice until done.
Blend green peppers and onions.
Fry mixture in palm oil with locust beans.
Add meats and seasoning, then simmer.
Serve stew with rice.

title: Okra Soup
summary: Slimy and nutritious soup cooked with okra, palm oil, and assorted proteins.
instructions: Chop or blend okra.
Cook meats and add palm oil.
Add okra and stir until slimy.
Add vegetables and crayfish, simmer, and serve.

title: Boli (Roasted Plantain)
summary: Charcoal-roasted ripe plantains, often served with groundnut sauce or peppered sauce.
instructions: Peel plantains and roast over charcoal until charred.
Serve hot with groundnut or pepper sauce.

title: Nkwobi
summary: A delicacy made from cow foot cooked in palm oil sauce and traditional spices.
instructions: Boil cow foot until tender.
Mix palm oil and potash until thick.
Add meat, ugba, and spices.
Stir and serve in a wooden bowl.

title: Zobo Drink
summary: Refreshing hibiscus flower drink spiced with ginger, cloves, and pineapple.
instructions: Boil hibiscus petals with ginger and cloves.
Add pineapple chunks and simmer.
Strain and chill.
Serve cold over ice.
